question.title: Eclipse eGit: Cannot move source files into Staged Changes
question.body:
This is a Java project using Eclipse and GitHub archiving -- has been running for several years.

Something weird happened with Eclipse (MacOS). I went to Search the workspace for a text string "initWireframes", and the software responded by changing the project's Node folder from "DataflowGeometry" --> "initWireframes/DataflowGeometry".

I could not undo. I've re-imported the project from GitHub, and everything is back EXCEPT: I cannot get modified .java files into "Stages Changes" during the Commit setup. Instead, eGit is placing them in "Unstaged Changes" and refuses my commands to move them into "Stages Changes"

Can anyone tell me how to repair this?

I explained that above

answers.body:
I went into the Repositories view, and deleted all the previous local repos attached to this project (after confirming the most recent repo (imported from Github) contained all the project Commit history.

Still that wasn't enough.

I went into the MacOS file system, and renamed all the old project-level folders (in the folder named "git") to block Eclipse from accessing them.

Then I quit Eclipse and restarted, choosing the same Workspace I've been using for years.

THIS SEEMS TO HAVE SOLVED THE PROBLEM.

Apparently, Eclipse was still reaching into one of the older repos?? I'll never know.

question_comments.body: I found the Error Log.  This is likely the error msg posted by the Eclipse UI:  "Not properly disposed SWT resource".  from the org.eclipse.ui.ide plug in
Correct, against my efforts, the files remain in the Unstaged Changes.  Eclipse just goes on as if nothing happened at the UI.
When you say they fail without any error in the UI, I assume you don't see anything happening when trying to stage files?

You shouldbe able to either press ctrl+3 and enter "Error Log" or click the "Window" toolbar entry and select "Show View" > "Error Log". The Error Log is a view just like the Console or Problems view.

I'm using MacOS.  I've tried all the different ways of adding files to the index, and they all fail with no error msg to the UI.  Where is the Eclipse Error Log file on the Mac?  The Project Explorer view shows the project resources in a hierarchical list.  The root NODE at the very top is what got unintentionally modified.

What do you mean with the project node's name beingchanged? What exactly happens when trying to stage the files? Is there something in the error log (Window>Show View>Error Log)? Does it make a difference whether you drag the files from unstaged changes to the staging area vs the corresponding "+" button?

79637295.body: I had a similar situation. I deleted a git, recreated it, refreshed it.  All the files showed in Unstaged Changes.  Plus and Double Plus did not appear to move them into Staged Changes.  So I Restarted Eclipse and then when I clicked inside an open editor for one of the files, the files were all in Staged Changes.  Seemed necessary to Restart.
